image.altText: Multiple officers dressed in hi-vis standing on a road at night time under a tent as the manhunt continues

props.synopsis: A massive search continues for a Porepunkah man who allegedly shot and killed two police officers at his property in rural Victoria. Follow live.

title.children: Alleged Porepunkah gunman still at large, carrying 'multiple firearms'

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police say several people have been "seriously injured" in the incident just west of Geelong on the Hamilton Highway.Â

title.children: Breaking: Several 'seriously injured' in school bus rollover west of Melbourne

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: The man accused of shooting dead two police officers in Victoria's north-east is a "sovereign citizen" who once called police offensive names and was involved in an attempt to have Daniel Andrews tried for treason.

title.children: Alleged Porepunkah shooter once described police as 'terrorist thugs'

image.altText: A composite image of West Coast's Harley Reid and St Kilda's Nasaiah Wanganeen-Milera.

props.synopsis: Harley Reid has confounded the speculation with his decision to stay in the west, but for players like him and Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera, the ferocious media spotlight is never likely to abate.

title.children: Harley and Nasiah's mega-deals only pause AFL's descent into new media world

image.altText: A male AFL player in a red kit roars with passion, exposing his teeth which are covered by a mouth guard

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast Suns stand on the precipice of what few Gold Coast-based sporting teams have done before. This yearâs Suns are looking to break a 25-year title drought on the coast after being reshaped in the image of their premiership-winning coach.

title.children: History beckons as Suns aim to rewrite Gold Coast's wretched sporting history

image.altText: Brownlow Medal

props.synopsis: Investigators say the four men collectively broke the law dozens of times, using corrupt conduct information to gamble on the 2021 and 2022 Brownlow medal awards.

title.children: Four men charged over alleged AFL Brownlow Medal betting scheme

image.altText: Will sitting at a coffee shop with a pot of tea in front of him.

props.synopsis: A delinquent teenager has been ordered to serve more than seven years behind bars for killing a man in a high-speed crash in Melbourne's south-east last year.

title.children: Teenage driver cries as judge jails him over deadly, high-speed crashÂ

props.synopsis: Iran was behind at least two antisemitic attacks on Australian soil, ASIO believes.

title.children: Australia expels Iranian ambassador after ASIO says it directed antisemitic attacks

image.altText: rural road with fence

props.synopsis: A 1,360-home housing estate in the Macedon Ranges is approved by the Victorian government, but nearby residents fear it will change the character of their town.

title.children: Fast-tracked housing estate angers country Victoria town

image.altText: Greg McMahon stands in front of a wired fence on the perimeter of the Rossdale Golf Course.

props.synopsis: Some community members in Melbourne's south-east are fighting plans to sell a privately-owned golf course used by the public, as the club behind it grapples with growing debt.

title.children: Residents up in arms over plans to sell a Melbourne golf course to developers

image.altText: A data centre

props.synopsis: A council in Melbourne's outer north has voted for more scrutiny over applications for resource-intensive data centres, with its deputy mayor warning the significant volumes of water they require could jeopardise new housing and population growth.Â

title.children: Council sounds alarm on 'tidal wave' of data centre water applications

image.altText: Burnt rubble of a house behind police tape.

props.synopsis: David Cartledge has admitted to lighting the fire that killed his housemate in 2023.

title.children: Man admits to lighting fatal house fire near Mildura

image.altText: balance bike laying on grass next to a yellow number 2

props.synopsis: A two-year-old boy is fighting for life after being hit by a van while he was crossing the road at a pedestrian crossing with his father.Â

title.children: Toddler on life support after being struck by van in Melbourne' south-east

image.altText: A sketch in tones of cream and brown of a woman with long hair standing with her arms by her side, frowning.

props.synopsis: The convicted triple-murderer faced lunch survivor Ian Wilkinson and her victims' loved ones during an emotional pre-sentence hearing in Melbourne on Monday.

title.children: Prosecutor wants jail with no parole for mushroom murderer Erin Patterson

image.altText: Man sitting in a ute, with sheep in the background.

props.synopsis: The effects of drought linger, but the season has taken a turn for the better in western Victoria, where above-average rainfall is forecast for spring.

title.children: Spring forecast brings optimism and relief as Victorian drought eases

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera while her left hip is being tattooed.

props.synopsis: Member for Mildura Jade Benham has had the image of a vanilla slice tattooed on her hip, in support of a local event and small business.

title.children: Nationals MP takes vanilla slice support to new level with tattoo

image.altText: Black and white still from CCTV footage of a man wearing a Scream mask and black clothing riding an e-scooter

props.synopsis: Police allege the South Yarra man targeted a local synagogue six times this year.

title.children: Man charged with multiple graffiti attacks on Melbourne synagogue

image.altText: Laura Pettenuzzo sits in a wheelchair, smiling, with a coffee in a cup holder

props.synopsis: Laura's struggles as a teenager were helped by friendships forged online. She wonders how things would have looked if a social media ban existed then.

title.children: 'I was lucky': How social media helped me find community in my teens

image.altText: Kelpie leaps over sheep

props.synopsis: A study estimates the nation's 270,000 working livestock dogs contributed to the economy at an amount similar to Australia's beef exports to the US in 2023-24.

title.children: Working dogs worth billions to the Australian economy

image.altText: Chris Flinos

props.synopsis: A crypto CEO accused of fraud in Abu Dhabi is now working at a suburban mortgage broker in Melbourne.

title.children: The collapsed crypto boss now working at a Melbourne mortgage broker

image.altText: A sign outside an Aldi store

props.synopsis: Unions and some retail workers are calling on major retailers to back down on mandatory bag checks and security gates.

title.children: Staff safety concerns raised over supermarket bag checks, security gates

image.altText: An image of Jay Brady multiplied that fades into background and a car and cheques on coloured background

props.synopsis: Court documents reveal the founder of a charity behind a cancelled bushfire recovery event was described by a judge as a "sophisticated fraudster" and convicted of multiple crimes of deception under a different name.

title.children: 'Sophisticated fraudster' behind cancelled Victorian bushfire charity event

image.altText: A large white and red ferry comes in to dock while people in the foreground watch from a wharf.

props.synopsis: The ship will stay in Hobart for about two months, then it will be moved to Victoria until it's ready to be used on the Bass Strait crossing in a year's time.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV set for storage in Victoria after Hobart fit-out

image.altText: A police car with flashing lights blocking the road with officers standing near another car in background.

props.synopsis: A man dies in hospital after being struck by a light-coloured SUV in Coburg on Sunday night.

title.children: Police search for driver following fatal hit-and-run north of Melbourne

image.altText: A group of people standing on the steps of parliament. Some of them raising their fists to the air.

props.synopsis:
In a matter of weeks, the Victorian government is set to introduce a bill to legislate Australia's first formal treaty with traditional owners.

But what does that mean?

props.synopsis: Over the weekend, Melissa Sambrooks, Kaitlin Barr and Greta Miller became the first ever female AFL boundary umpires.

title.children: 'Couldn't stop smiling': First female boundary umpires in AFL

image.altText: Anthony Radford two (also good for generic)

props.synopsis: Community members and local authors are concerned Bendigo's reputation has been damaged following this year's Bendigo Writers Festival controversy, which resulted in more than 50 writers and hosts withdrawing.

title.children: Regional city fears reputational hit over writers' festival fallout

image.altText: A close up photo of a phone with dating apps like Tinder, Grindr and Bumble on the screen.

props.synopsis: Online dating offers a bigger pool of potential partners, but a new study shows it can lead to less passionate, satisfying and intimate relationships.Â

title.children: Online dating may not be the best way to meet a partner, study shows

image.altText: An aerial view of a car accident with a damaged car and a fire truck, and firefighters.

props.synopsis: Two drivers are killed at Toolern Vale when a vehicle observed by police officers to be speeding crashed head-on into another car.

title.children: Two dead after head-on collision involving allegedly stolen car

image.altText: A laughing girl holds a young wombat above her head in a bright yellow canola field.

props.synopsis: A mother who lost her toddler son in an all-too-common farm accident turns to writing and launches a foundation to support farming families.

title.children: Rescue wombat helps grieving family find 'real joy' after son's death

image.altText: Glass shattered on the floor of a house

props.synopsis: Three people are stabbed following an alleged home invasion in Melbourne's west, police say.

title.children: Three stabbed in home invasion in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Cars queue on a road under overcast skies.

props.synopsis: The outer Melbourne community where only 1.2 per cent of people use public transport.Â

title.children: 'Deliver it now': Outer suburbs councils call for new stations to ease choked roads

image.altText: man standing in front of a curved bar

props.synopsis: As more regional bank branches close, a new alliance is pushing back against the Big Four.

title.children: Lobby group calls for levy on major banks that close regional branches

image.altText: Two people wearing possum skins pass a traditional object between each other.

props.synopsis: In coming weeks the Victorian government is set to introduce a bill to legislate Australia's first formal treaty with traditional owners. The ABC can reveal it's expected to give Victoria's elected Aboriginal body powers to establish new institutions â like a proposed education institute.Â

title.children: New details emerge as Australia's first formal Treaty imminent in Victoria

image.altText: South Melbourne FC fans hold up scarves in the stands at an Australia Cup game.

props.synopsis: In a fixture dubbed The Big Show, more than 9,000 screaming fans packed this local football game in a sign these clubs could be ready for the A-League.

title.children: After packing out the 'Big Show', these clubs want a shot in the big leagues
